SourcedStatement: But Niobrara County’s Democrats, who account for just 2.6% of registered voters, are the most outnumbered by Republicans in the 30 states that track local party affiliation, according to Associated Press election data.
Name: Associated Press

SourcedStatement: Nationwide, Democrats account for fewer than 3% of voters in three counties this year, up from one county in 2020 but down from seven in 2016. There were none with such a low percentage of Democratic registrations in the presidential election years of 2012, 2008 and 2004, according to the AP data.
Name: Associated Press

SourcedStatement: In Niobrara County, Wyoming, the least-populated county in the least-populated state, Becky Blackburn is one of just 32 left.
Name: Becky Blackburn

SourcedStatement: Her neighbors call her “the crazy Democrat,” although it’s more a term of endearment than derision.
Name: Becky Blackburn

SourcedStatement: A paralegal for the Republican county attorney, Blackburn hears a lot of right-wing views around town.
Name: Becky Blackburn
Title: Paralegal
Justification: A paralegal for the Republican county attorney

SourcedStatement: “Normally I just roll my eyes and walk away because I’m fighting a losing battle and I’m fully aware of that,” she said. “Maybe that is why I’m well-liked, because I keep my mouth shut 10 times more than I want to.”
Name: Becky Blackburn
Title: Paralegal

SourcedStatement: She flies an LGBTQ+ flag in support of her lesbian daughter at her house in Lusk, a ranching town of 1,500 and the Niobrara County seat.
Name: Becky Blackburn
Title: Paralegal

SourcedStatement: In political season, Blackburn stocks up on Democratic political signs to replace those that get swiped.
Name: Becky Blackburn
Title: Paralegal

SourcedStatement: She speaks approvingly of policing reform, taxation for government services and the transgender social media celebrity Dylan Mulvaney.
Name: Becky Blackburn
Title: Paralegal

SourcedStatement: Maybe because she’s open about those views — and far too outnumbered to put them into action — Blackburn really does seem well-liked in Lusk, where she recently served nine years on the Town Council.
Name: Becky Blackburn
Title: Paralegal;Town Council Member
Justification: recently served nine years on the Town Council

SourcedStatement: “I won two elections here. Even though that’s nonpartisan, people still knew I had left-leaning values,” she said.
Name: Becky Blackburn
Title: Paralegal;Town Council Member

SourcedStatement: “You feel skeevy and dirty when you do it. But you do it anyway and you change it back as soon as you can, because you don’t want to start getting the Republican mailings,” Blackburn said.
Name: Becky Blackburn
Title: Paralegal;Town Council Member

SourcedStatement: Wyoming’s Republican secretary of state, Chuck Gray, said in a statement of approval.
Name: Chuck Gray
Title: Wyoming’s Republican secretary of state

SourcedStatement: Party-switching had “undermined the sanctity of Wyoming’s primary process,”
Name: Chuck Gray
Title: Wyoming’s Republican secretary of state

SourcedStatement: Yet the area had a Democratic state representative not too long ago: Ross Diercks, who is recognized and warmly greeted at the Outpost Cafe, a homey breakfast and lunch spot in Lusk.
Name: Ross Diercks
Title: Democratic state representative
Justification: Democratic state representative not too long ago

SourcedStatement: A former middle school English teacher, Diercks was a Republican before deciding the GOP didn’t do enough to support public education. He beat a Republican incumbent in 1992 to launch an 18-year run in the Legislature.
Name: Ross Diercks
Title: former middle school English teacher;State Legislator
Justification: A former middle school English teacher;launched an 18-year run in the Legislature

SourcedStatement: Knowing voters personally and keeping up on issues helped him hold office. When he got a C-minus on a National Rifle Association questionnaire, for example, he resolved to improve. For subsequent elections, he scored A’s on the survey.
Name: Ross Diercks
Title: former middle school English teacher;State Legislator

SourcedStatement: Many Republican lawmakers are friends. When one from just down the road died, he sang at his funeral.
Name: Ross Diercks
Title: former middle school English teacher;State Legislator

SourcedStatement: Then in 2022, Diercks temporarily switched parties to vote in the GOP primary against Harriet Hageman, who was challenging then-Rep. Liz Cheney for the state’s lone House seat. Hageman, the daughter of the lawmaker he sang for at his funeral, nonetheless won the race by a wide margin.
Name: Ross Diercks
Title: former middle school English teacher;State Legislator

SourcedStatement: The new law keeping Diercks and others from switching their registration so easily has him exasperated with the GOP.
Name: Ross Diercks
Title: former middle school English teacher;State Legislator

SourcedStatement: “How far are they going to go to limit one’s ability to vote? If it really comes down to purifying the party, on a voting level all the way up to the elected officials, pretty soon there isn’t going to be anyone left who’s pure enough to be in the party,” Diercks said.
Name: Ross Diercks
Title: former middle school English teacher;State Legislator

SourcedStatement: Truck driver Pat Jordan supports many left-leaning goals, including universal healthcare, but said he only registers as a Republican.
Name: Pat Jordan
Title: Truck driver

SourcedStatement: “The best way to participate in meaningful change is to try to sway the dominant party,” said Jordan, who lives in Niobrara County. “You know, we need to have a government that serves the people, all of them, not just Republicans and not just rural and not just urban and not just Democrats — and definitely not just the rich and the wealthy.”
Name: Pat Jordan
Title: Truck driver

SourcedStatement: Last winter, dozens of locals gathered outside to honk and cheer as one Democrat left town. But they weren’t cheering as Ed Fullmer was headed off for good.
Name: Ed Fullmer

SourcedStatement: Fullmer was on the high school boys basketball team bus as they left for the state championship. They lost, but Fullmer coached the Tigers to their best record in a decade, 20-8.
Name: Ed Fullmer
Title: Coach

SourcedStatement: He said people know his views but rarely put him on the spot about politics.
Name: Ed Fullmer
Title: Coach

SourcedStatement: “Most people don’t want to dive into those type of discussions,” he said. “They respect you for what you do, how you work.”
Name: Ed Fullmer
Title: Coach

SourcedStatement: Blackburn, for one, intends to hold her political ground, even as it shrinks around her.
Name: Becky Blackburn
Title: Paralegal;Town Council Member

SourcedStatement: “I am who I am, and I have the views that I have,” she said. “And I don’t care if it bothers people or not.”
Name: Becky Blackburn
Title: Paralegal;Town Council Member
